body: @colesbury Could you explain your comment? As I understand `torch._C._standard_gamma()` draws a random sample (without knowledge of derivatives), whereas `alpha._standard_gamma()` draws a sample with knowledge of derivatives. I'm using the `torch._C._standard_gamma()` without derivatives in #4117, where the derivative needs to be computed in a different way.
